section.title: Releases
section.p: For all releases prior to 0.9.6, the release notes can be found here.

release.description: Maintenance release for Castor XML and JDO

summary.p: This is the final 0.9.9 release, a feature release for Castor JDO and XML.
Please note that we are providing the usual suspects (binaries, docs and sources) for this release at the Codehaus.
We are currently planning for a Castor 1.0 release in about 8+ weeks, which we mainly see as a bug fix release and a one-time opportunity to get the HTML documentation into a better shape .. ;-).
Please note that we have - in addition to the features added and bugs fixed as documented with 0.9.9M1 and 0.9.9M2 - started to makes substantial changes to the project documentation as follows:

ul.li: Addition of the first Castor JDO HOW-TO pages
Addition of an initial (hence draft) Castor JDO best practice document
Addition of a Castor JDO feature page

summary.p: As mentioned above, these pages are work in progress and shall be expanded for the upcoming 1.0 release.

bug.description: Fixed JDO.getDatabase()NullPointerException.

summary.p: Please note that we are providing the usual suspects (binaries, docs and sources) for this release at the Codehaus. We recommend, though, to download the complete package, as the HTML docs at the main Castor site has not been updated, and to build the documentation yourself.
Preparations for the final release have started. Since the last release candidate, the following problem areas have been addressed.

bug.description: Removed references to Poolman from documentation on pooling.
Integrated original test case provided into Castor CTF.
Prefer to use setter with reference type before setter with primitive type if multiple setters are available.
Fixed problem with class resolution during loading polymorphic objects.
Added marketplace section

summary.p: Please note that we are providing the usual suspects (binaries, docs and sources) for this release at the Codehaus. We recommend, though, to download the complete package, as the HTML docs at the main Castor site has not been updated, and to build the documentation yourself.
Support for polymorphism has been completely rewritten, allowing you to load objects that are part of an extend relationship by their base types, with Castor JDO returning the actual (leaf) classes.
With the following class hierarchy ...
it will be possible to execute OQL queries as follows:
summary.code: SELECT product FROM Product product
summary.p: and Castor JDO will return the actual Laptop and Server instances. For a complete set of code examples, please review src/tests/ctf/jdo/tc9x/TestPolymorphism.java.
Both castor-0.x.y.jar and castor-0.x.y-xml.jar now carry an updated and up-to-date MANIFEST file.
Support for Apache Derby (starting with release 10.1.1.0) has been added. For initial information about configuration of Castor JDO for the use with Apache Derby, please see src/tests/jdo/derby.xml.

Known issues:
No support for LIMIT clause
No support for identity key generator (temporarily)
No support for SELECT .. FOR UPDATE statements.
As of this release, four new cache types have been added:

As some of these cache implementations allow you to use it in a distributed mode, this allows Castor JDO to be used in a clustered (multi-JVM) environment. In such an environment, Castor JDO wil make use of the underlying cache provider to replicate/distribute the cache content between the various JDOManager instances.
summary.h3: Support for transient attribute for <sql> mappings
summary.p: Support for the transient attribute has been added to the <sql> element has been added. This allows you to define a field mapping as follows:
summary.code: <field name="prop1" type="string"> <sql name="prop_1" transient="true" /> <bind-xml name="property1" /> </field>
summary.p: allowing you to include a field for XML un-/marshalling, but exclude it from persistence.

Enumerations are a common method for ensuring data integrity, both in software and in relational databases. As a platform for linking the two, we added support for persisting class fields whose type is a Java typesafe enumeration to Castor JDO.

To use this new feature your typesafe enumeration should follow the enum pattern commonly used and provide a static valueOf(String) method. An enum of different kinds of computer equipment may look like:
At your Product class you may want to have a property that tells you what kind of computer equipment a product is of.
Your mapping for the Product class should be:
summary.code: <class name="Product" identity="id"> <description>Product with kind enum</description> <map-to table="enum_prod"/> <field name="id" type="integer"> <sql name="id" type="integer"/> </field> <field name="name" type="string"> <sql name="name" type="char"/> </field> <field name="kind" type="KindEnum"> <sql name="kind" type="char"/> </field> </class>
summary.p: To add this new feature we added an additional check when searching for field types. Like before Castor first searches for know types and thereafter for a mapping for the class you specified as type. If both of them do not match it now checks if the class specified as type is available at classpath and has a static valueOf(String) method. Only if all of this conditions are met it will be viewed as a valid mapping.

Pre patch we always returned a boolean value even if the database contained a value which does not conform to the rules defined. This behaviour caused that we could load records with wrong values without problems but got a ObjectModifiedException when we tried to update these values as our update statment includes checking of all old values in the where clause of SQL statement.

With the patch this behavier changes to strict checking if the loaded char/string value matches one of the boolean characters defined by conversion rule. If the value does not match a ClassCastException explaing the fail reason will be thrown.

Several code areas of Castor JDO have been severly refactored or rewritten from scratch, leading to some significantly improved runtime performance. This includes amongst others a reduced execution time when dealing with a large number of entities loaded as part of a single transaction, etc.

bug.description: Added release notes for 0.9.9M1.
Added ant targets to to check code conventions with checkstyle.
Calculation of priority to execute create and delete statements at commit returns wrong results when no keygen is used or class depends/extends another.
Changed argument handling code.
Completely refactored ClassMolder, introducing strategy objects for field resolution.
Added additional check for various built-in types when deciding whether or not to use the parent classes namespace if no local namespace has been defined.

contributor.name: Michael Westbay
contributor.email: westbay AT users DOT sourceforge DOT net

reporter.name: Michael Westbay
reporter.email: westbay AT users DOT sourceforge DOT net

bug.description: Refactored how transaction managers are maintained.
Stricter checking at type conversion from string to boolean.
Created a test case for configuring JDO DataSource using a Properties collection.
Fix syntax failures in sapdb.sql script and improve sapdb test coverage.
Replaced MimeBase64Encoder/Decoder with new implementation Base64Encoder/Decoder.

reporter.name: Bruce Snyder
reporter.email: bruce DOT snyder AT gmail DOT com

bug.description: Refactored MANIFEST files and their usage within Castor
Added support for various distributed caches.
JDO support for typesafe enumerations.
Added code to set identity upon registering objects with ObjectTracker
Allow to initialize JDOManager with a preconfigured DataSource.
Solved problem using JDOConfFactory and transaction demarcation specification.
Place all JDO unit tests in a new src/tests/utf/org/exolab/castor/ tree.

reporter.name: Bruce Snyder
reporter.email: bruce DOT snyder AT gmail DOT com

bug.description: Update docs on the limit clause support for OQL.

reporter.name: Bruce Snyder
reporter.email: bruce DOT snyder AT gmail DOT com

bug.description: Refactored access to caches, adding CacheEntry class and making OID and CacheEntry implement java.io.Serializable.
Remove deleteExtend method from ClassMolder.
Refactor how JDBC connection factories are maintained.
Added support for polymorphism.
Refactor CTF-JDO tests into subdirectories (part 2).
Added DB2 category to src/tests/tests.xml.
Complete rewrite of TransactionContext with regards to obejct tracking.
Added org.castor package to src/main.
Added performance test-suite for 1:n relations of JDO.
Added support for transient attribute at the <sql> element.
Removed hidden catch-block in LockEngine.updateCache().

release.description: Maintenance release for Castor XML and JDO

summary.p: This is the final 0.9.7. release, mainly a maintenance release. We are currently planning the next release which will be Castor 0.9.9, a feature release.
summary.h3: Moved key generators to jdo.keygen package
summary.p: Whilst this change is non-intrusive per se, please note that you might have to change a local castor.properties file if you happened to re-specify key generators in there.
Support for multiple database configurations has been re-enabled.

bug.description: Reverted addition to src/tests/jdo/Collections due to problem with missing setItem(ArrayList).
Moved key generators to jdo.keygen package.
JDOManager can now handle more then one jdo-conf.
Update project documentation.

summary.p: Please note that we are providing the usual suspect (binaries, docs and sources) for this release at the Codehaus. We recommend, though, to download the complete package, as the HTML docs at the main Castor site has not been updated, and to build the documentation yourself.

Proxy classes for java.sql.Connection and java.sql.PreparedStatement instances have been added, to allow for complete and better JDBC statements to be output to the log files. As this might impose a performance penalty at run-time, we have added a new property to the Castor property file (castor.properties) to allow configuration of this feature.
summary.code: # True if JDBC proxy classes should be used to enable more detailed logging output of SQL # statements; false otherwise (logging will be turned off completely). # org.exolab.castor.persist.useProxy=true
summary.p: When disabled, no logging of SQL statements will occur al all.

Several bugs have been fixed to allow use of Castor with a JDK 1.5. This mainly involved preventing compilation problems due to variable names et al. that were in conflict with new Java 5 naming conventions (e.g. use of enum as a variable name).
JDO2 has been renamed to JDOManager. Please change your source code accordingly. Please note that - going forward - any bug fixes/enhancements will be committed against JDOManager only.
summary.h3: Type of access mode constants changed
summary.p: The type of the access mode constants (Shared / ReadOnly / Exclusive / DbLocked) defined in Database interface has changed from short to org.exolab.castor.mapping.AccessMode. To allow you to use previous short as well as new AccessMode constants we added new incarnations of the Database.load(..) and Query.execute(..) methods. In addition we needed to change the parameter types of Persistent.jdoLoad(..) and CallbackInterceptor.loaded(..) from short to AccessMode.
It is possible again - after disabling this feature in 0.9.6 - to not specify a type in a field mapping. By default, a field defined as such will have a type of 'java.lang.String'.
summary.h3: Addition of RSS feed for announcements
summary.p: An RSS feed has been added to the project documentation to allow users to be informed about additions/changes to Castor. This feed basically mirrors the news items posted to http://castor.codehaus.org/news.html
summary.h3: Specifying a binding file with the Source generator Ant task
summary.p: Support for specifying a binding file with the Castor Source Generator Ant Task has been added. Below is the example as provided with the 0.9.6 release notes extended to cover the specification of a binding file:
summary.code:
<target name="castor:gen:src" depends="init" description="Generate Java source files from XSD.">
<taskdef name="castor-srcgen" classname="org.exolab.castor.tools.ant.taskdefs.CastorSourceGenTask" classpathref="castor.class.path" /> <mkdir dir="${gen.src.d}" /> <castor-srcgen file="${schema.d}/books2.xsd" todir="${gen.src.d}" package="com.sourcebeat.castorlive.xmodel" types="j2" bindingfile="custom-binding.xml" warnings="false" /> </target>
summary.p: Since release 0.9.6, the following problem areas have been addressed.

bug.description: Anonymous groups in complex types are disambiguated unnecessarily
Extra element not ignored in UnmarshalHandler.startElement although it should be ignored.
Added support for multi-value attributes
Restore default behaviour when no type is specified for a field mapping
Changed column names in SQL statement of CallSql to lower-case.
Changed documentation from JDO2 to JDOManager.
Replaced Ant 1.5 with Ant 1.6.x.
Added documentation about JDBC proxy classes (incl. property in castor.properties).
Changed column name 'num' to 'numb', as 'num' happens to be a keyword with SAPDB.
Added patch to allow CastorSourceGenTask to specify a binding file.
Refactor CTF-JDO tests into subdirectories (part 1).
build.xml now uses sourc generator Ant task definitio during code generation.
Issues with Namespace Handling in SAX2Any and AnyNode2SAX2
Added Java 5 "enum" support to Java Source API
Added ability to add exceptions to JConstructor.
Fixes issue with using location attribute with both attributes and text nodes the same location element.
Added proxy classes for JDBC Connection and PreparedStatement to improve SQL statement logging.
Added cast of null needed for some reflection methods for Java5.
Fixed compile error on Java5 caused by the usage of "enum" as identifier in JDO tests.
Improve the error messages related to the use of key generators.
Reworked the Cache interface to be 100% compliant with java.util.Map.
Improved the way Castor JDO logs error messages if a transaction fails.
Added java.sql.Connection getJdbcConnection() to Database interface to obtain a handle to the underlying JDBC connection.
This required the refactoring of all key generators to extract the supportsSqlType() method which is now called early rather than late from within the SQLEngine constructor.

contributor.name: Bruce Snyder
contributor.email: bruce DOT snyder AT gmail DOT com

submitter.name: Bruce Snyder
submitter.email: bruce DOT snyder AT gmail DOT com

bug.description: Added type casts to Types.java to overcome runtime exceptions with Java 1.4.x.
Improved logging of exceptions related to security policy at Configuration.
Added JDOManager.loadConfiguration(JdoConf).
Multiple <database> problems.
Refactor AccessMode.
Committed: more information on error when manipulating collections
Fixed CastorException prints "Caused by: " to System.err in all cases.
Test for open transaction before closing it.
Add template for submitting a bug report.
Fixed problem in field molder when dealing with 'set' methods with more than one signature.
Surrounded logging-statements with isDebugEnabled() if the logging-string is assembled.
Fixed typo in transaction manager class for WAS v4 and add note that database pooling should be enabled for WAS v4 and v5.
Fixed misleading error messages referencing to "javax.jta.TransactionManager" instead of "javax.transaction.TransactionManager".
Extend FieldHandlerImpl to be able to handle multiple overloaded set methods. This now makes possible to specify the pooling parameter "cache-scheme" for Oracle connects.
Fixed bug with cryptic message at 1:m relation with depends relationship.
Fixed failure in hash code calculation of org.exolab.castor.persist.spi.Complex.
Added RSS news feed
Fixed Compile issue on JDK 1.5.0_01.
Elimination of unnecessary compiler warnings.
Fixed wrong class and method name for Websphere 5.0 transaction manager factory.

release.description: Bug fixes in Castor JDO, XML.

summary.p: This is the final 0.9.6. release. We are currently planning the next milestone release which will be Castor 1.0.
- Creating Custom FieldHandlers
Final release. Since the third release candidate, the following problem areas have been addressed.

bug.description: Updated documentation to explain that no auto-mapping of java.util.Date takes place; users must decide whether to map a particular date field to java.sql.Date, java.sql.Time, or java.sql.Timestamp.
Fixed problem with TransactionContext.getObjectEntry(Object) that was introduced as a result of adding support for lazy loading 1:1 relations.
Added F.A.Q. entry describing compatibility problems between various releases of mySQL 4.1.x and its JDBC drivers.
Reverted various DOCTYPE definitions in src/tests/jdo to use DTDs.

Fixed issue with GeneralizedFieldHandler not able to handle collections. Collections are now automatically iterated over during getValue() calls and each item in the collection is passed into the convertUponGet method. To retain the old behavior simply add a call to #setCollectionIteration with a value of false in the constructor of your GeneralizedFieldHandler. The behavior for setter methods is not changed since only one item at a time is passed into the setter already.

Fixed whitespace processing bug, where a ' ' was actually getting appended to the end of a string value if the parser was calling the #characters method again with only whitespace following a previous call to #characters method where valid content existed.
Fixed recent issue where ElementDecl#getType() method was always returning null for element references.

release.description: Bug fixes in Castor JDO, XML

summary.p: Preparations for the final release have started. Since the second release candidate, the following problem areas have been addressed.

bug.description: Added getCacheManager() method in Database interface
Fixed problem with loading mappings with relative path
Mapping.loadMapping(String) duplicates directory path. Fixed problem by making the given url a relative URL so that the document base isn't duplicated.
Fixed various problems that prevented compilation under JDK 1.3.
Fixed syntax error in src/tests/jdo/mysql.sql.
Improved exception handling during TransactionContext instantiation.
Changed attribute type for 'name' attribute on key-generator element definition in mapping.dtd.
Overloaded jdo.Size with Oracle-specific test case.
Various problems with classloader usage.
SimleQueryExecutor and data visibility issues
Added some additional support for nillable fields. There is still some more work needed in this area, but this gets us closer.
Added initial support to suppress namespaces during Marshalling. This has been a long asked for feature, so I figured it was about time I finally got around to doing this.

release.description: Mainly bug fixes, but also minor enhancements in Castor JDO.

summary.p: There's an issue with Castor finding mapping files within JARs when the path to the mapping file is specified relatively to the JDO configuration file. We are working on this, but as there's a workaround (using InputSources as mentioned on the mailing lists recently), we have decided to go ahead and not hold back this second release candidate. Details on this bug can be found here.
Since the first release candidate, the following problem areas have been addressed.

bug.description: Fixed NullPointerException thrown during Castor Validation
Added support for lazy-loading simple 1:1 relations
Status property of Castor's TransactionContext not set correctly in global transactions.
Castor JDO test suite now uses log level "error" by default.
Fixed problem in CastorException? (String, Throwable) where the constructor of the superclass was not called.
Fixed problem with resetting the capacity of CountLimited? cache.
Fixed problem with "sqltime" field type where it was incorrectly mapped to java.sql.Date rather than java.sql.Time.
Added additional debug statements during binding of SQL parameters.
Adds configuration of JDO using an inline JDBC DataSource by providing configuration parameters using a Properties collection.
Fixed problem using JDOConfFactory with JDBC DataSources.
Added support for using constants in comparison expressions with bind values.
Handling of SQL parameter binding and their order is now completely handled by SqlBindParser.
Added support for SQL parameters as part of IN statements in WHERE clauses.

release.description: Mainly bug fixes, but also contains enhancements in Castor JDO, XML.

summary.p: Please note that we are providing the usual suspect (binaries, docs and sources) for this release at the Exolab FTP server. We recommend, though, to download the complete package, as the HTML docs at the main Castor site have not been updated, and build the documentation yourself.
summary.h3: Format of the JDO configuration file
summary.p: Due to various internal refactorings, we decide to change the syntax of the JDO configuration file, adding a new root element named <jdo-conf> and elements to declare transaction demarcation semantics. Here's a sample of Castor JDO running against mySQL (with local transactions).
summary.code:
<?xml version="1.0"?> <!DOCTYPE jdo-conf PUBLIC "-//EXOLAB/Castor JDO Configuration DTD Version 1.0//EN" "http://castor.exolab.org/jdo-conf.dtd">
<jdo-conf> <database name="test" engine="mysql" > <driver url="jdbc:mysql://localhost/test" class-name="org.gjt.mm.mysql.Driver"> <param name="user" value="test" /> <param name="password" value="test" /> </driver> <mapping href="mapping.xml" /> </database> <transaction-demarcation mode="local" /> </jdo-conf>
summary.p: When setting up JDBC DataSources to be used with Castor JDO, configuration of parameters now needs to occur as a sequence of <param> elements rather than one <params> element. This is to stream-line the way these JDBC resources are configured.
What used to be
summary.code: <data-source class-name="com.sybase.jdbc2.jdbc.SybDataSource"> <params user="thomas" password="thomas" port-number="2048" server-name="Dual1" database-name="thomas" /> </data-source>
summary.p: before this release, now needs to be specifed as follows:
summary.code: <data-source class-name="com.sybase.jdbc2.jdbc.SybDataSource"> <param name="user" value="thomas" /> <param name="password" value="thomas" /> <param name="port-number" value="2048" /> <param name="server-name" value="Dual1" /> <param name="database-name" value="thomas" /> </data-source>
summary.p: Please note the use of hyphens in the naming of properties. In other words, in order for Castor to set the value of the portNumber property of the SybDataSource to '2048', please use the following <param> element
summary.code: <param name="port-number" value="2048" />
summary.p: rather than
summary.code: <param name="portNumber" value="2048" />
summary.p: as shown in the pooling documentation for previous releases.

A new way of configuring transaction demarcation has been added. This configuration is now part of the main JDO configuration file (jdo-conf) and mandates the specification of the transaction demarcation used within your application.

As part of this configuration file, the user has to specify which transaction demarcation to use. This can either be 'local' or 'global', and is supplied by the use of a <transaction-demarcation> element.
When using Castor JDO stand-alone and you want Castor to control transaction demarcation ('local' mode), please use this element as follows:
summary.code: <transaction-demarcation mode="local" />
summary.p: When running inside a J2EE application server, and you want to use container managed transactions ('global' transactions), please make sure you use this element as follows:
summary.code: <transaction-demarcation mode="global"> <transaction-manager name="jndi" /> </transaction-demarcation>
summary.p: In this mode, the XML element <transaction-manager> specifies the transaction manager that is used by your application server/web container to control these transactions.
The following transaction managers are supported in Castor at the time of the release of Castor 0.9.6:

tr.td: TM looked up in the JNDI ENC

summary.p: In addition to specifying the transaction manager name, it is possible to pass arbitrary name/value pairs to the transaction manager instance.

Note:It should also be noted that "database pooling" must be enabled for the JDO instance when using the WAS v4 and v5 transaction managers, or the JDO "database" instance will fall outside the current transaction/thread, resulting in the error message "No transaction in progress for the current thread". For example:
summary.code: JDO myJdo = new JDO(); myJdo.setDatabasePooling( true );
summary.p: Note: At the moment, only the JNDI transaction manager factory supports such an attribute. In this context, the jndiEnc attribute can be used to specify what JNDI ENC to use to lookup the transaction manager as shown below:
summary.code: <transaction-demarcation mode="global"> <transaction-manager name="jndi"> <param name="jndiEnc" value="java:comp/env/TransactionManager" /> </transaction-manager> </transaction-demarcation>
summary.h3: Using timezone information when accessing date/time/timestamp data
summary.p: Castor will use the JDBC ResultSet.getDate(int, Calendar) and related methods which take a Calendar object to specify the timezone of the data retrieved from the database when the timezone information is not already specified in the data; this ensures that the 'current' timezone is applied.

The default time zone can be configured in the castor.properties file; see the configuration section for details on how to configure Castor with information about your default time zone. To change the timezone to a different timezone than the default, please set a (different) value on the org.exolab.castor.jdo.defaultTimeZone property:
summary.code: # Default time zone to apply to dates/times fetched from database fields, # if not already part of the data. Specify same format as in # java.util.TimeZone.getTimeZone, or an empty string to use the computer's # local time zone. # org.exolab.castor.jdo.defaultTimeZone= org.exolab.castor.jdo.defaultTimeZone=GMT+8:00
summary.h3: JDO configuration without a file and JDoConfFactory
summary.p: As part of this release, we have added a way to configure Castor JDO without the need to provide an XML configuration file. As such,
summary.code: JDO.setConfiguration(JdoConf)
summary.p: has been provided to pass in an instance of JdoConf. Too assist users of this new approach in creating JdoConf instances, please have a look at org.exolab.castor.jdo.util.JdoConfFactory.

In order to clear all previously registered Castor Database configurations you can now call the new function org.exolab.castor.jdo.engine.DatabaseRegistry.clear(). This is for example usefull, if you want to log on using a user supplied login name and database connection. It is especially needed if it's possible to change the login password of the database login account in interactive applications.

With this release, we have decided to remove several methods related to clearing caches (partially) from Database(impl).java. Instead, we have created a new CacheManager class in the util package that can be obtained from a Database instance as follows:
summary.code: Database db = jdo.getDatabase(); CacheManager manager = db.getCacheManager();
summary.p: Once such an instance has been obtained, cache content can be cleared (partially) using one of several CacheManager?.clearCache() methods. In addition, users might inquire about whether an object is currently cached (or not) by using CacheManager.isCached (Class, Object).
Details about the functionality provided by this new class can be found in the HTML docs and/or Javadocs.
On a selected number of RDBMS, Castor JDO now supports the use of LIMIT (and OFFSET clauses) as follows:
This will select accounts 6 to 15, given that numbers for account ids start at 1.
As per this release, the following RDBMS have full/partial support for this new feature.
1) Oracle has full support for LIMIT/OFFSET clauses for release 8.1.6 and later.
summary.h3: OQL - bind variables in combination with "IN" operators
summary.p: Previously it was only possible to use OQL WHERE statements with "IN" operators of the following form:
summary.code: "... WHERE DNAME in list(1, 2, 3)" "... WHERE DNAME in list(\"SALES\", \"TEST\", \"ABC\")" "... WHERE DNAME in list(\"ABC\", nil)"
summary.p: To make it easier executing dynamic queries, it's now also allowed to use bind variables, for example:
summary.code: "... WHERE DNAME in list($1, $2)"
summary.p: If you are not satisfied with Castor's set of performance caches, we've added a way for you to provide you own cache implementationa and register it with Castor.
To provide a custom cache implementation, you need to

ol.li: Create a class that implements org.exolab.castor.persist.cache.Cache (we have provided an abstract base class that you can use at your convenience).
Create a class that implements org.exolab.castor.persist.cache.CacheFactory (we have provided an abstract base class that you can use at your convenience).
Register your custom cache implementation with Castor JDO in the castor.properties file.

summary.p: Detailed instructions can be found in the package.html file of the org.exolab.castor.persist.cache package.
The Castor Source Generator Ant Task has been added to the CVS tree. Below is an example of how to use it from within an Ant build descriptor:
summary.code:
<target name="castor:gen:src" depends="init" description="Generate Java source files from XSD.">
<taskdef name="castor-srcgen" classname="org.exolab.castor.tools.ant.taskdefs.CastorSourceGenTask" classpathref="castor.class.path" /> <mkdir dir="${gen.src.d}" /> <castor-srcgen file="${schema.d}/books2.xsd" todir="${gen.src.d}" package="com.sourcebeat.castorlive.xmodel" types="j2" warnings="false" /> </target>
summary.p: The only requirement is that the castor-srcgen-ant-task.jar must be on the CLASSPATH.

Due to a couple of inconsistencies in the interface of the JDO class, we have decided to refactor this class and provide users with a much improved way of configuring and instantiating JDO instances (as explained below). To provide backwards-compatibility, we have created a new JDO2 class and left the old untouched.
To create a Castor JDO instance (based upon a XML configuration file), users need to execute code similar to the following lines:
summary.code: JDO2.loadConfiguration ("jdo-conf.xml"); JDO2 jdo = JDO2.createInstance ("test");
summary.p: Similar to what the old interface used to be, a couple of overloaded loadConfiguration() methods are provided, to allow specification of class loaders and XML entity resolvers.

bug.description: Added support for namespace to package mappings on the Unmarshaller and UnmarshalHandler. This basically fixes issues where Castor can't find the right package to look for classes during unmarshalling. This is main for those people using generated source code, as using a mapping file you must specify the packages and namespaces appropriately.
Fixed bug in SourceGenerator where class names for SimpleType instances with Enumeration facets were not getting resolved properly.
Added additional debug statements during binding of SQL parameters.
Added a new isCached() method to CacheManager.
Castor JDO now uses timezone information when reading date/timestamp/time data from the RDBMS.
Updated src/tests/jdo/oracle.xml and src/tests/jdo/postgresql.xml to be in-line with new grammar.
Extends new SQL parameter binding code to SimpleQueryExecutor.
Improved exception handling in the persist.cache package, by ensuring proper exception chaining.
Brought configuration of <data-source> in line with <driver>, switching from <params> to a sequence of <param> elements.
Added the Castor Ant Task and an Ant target to the build jar.
Added core/** package and children to castor-xml.jar.
Brought jdo-conf.dtd in-line with XML Schema instance, making <transaction-demarcation> required.
Fixed StackOverflowError that was occuring at certain times during container processing if the input XML was invalid.
Added new (experimental) JDO2.java, adding factory method for instantiation, removing public constructor, changing way of loading configuration.
DecimalValidator was not taking into account a leading sign ('+' or '-').
Fixed problem with finding add<FieldName>() method.
Framed <driver>, <data-source> and <jndi> elements in jdo-conf.xsd with an <xsd:choice> to indicate that at any time only one should be present.
Re-enabled support for LIMIT clauses for MS SQL Server.
Changed Log4J configuration to use XML file (log4j.xml).
Initial support for xsi:nil. xsi:nil support is not complete with these patches, but it was worth checking them in as it gets us closer to completion.
UnmarshalState._markedList Vector is a performance bottleneck, replaced by a by HashSet.
Fixed Whitepspace handling where whitespace was not preserved for container objects.
Whilespace was not getting preserved correctly during unmarshalling when parser splits up calls to the UnmarshalHandler#characters method.
Updated the Marshaller to use ContentHandler directly instead of wrapping in a ParserAdapter. Users Marshalling to a ContentHandler should see a significant speed up when Marshalling.

Fixed a bug in the Marshaller with the xsi:type logic not being strict enough. Sometimes the Marshaller was not adding xsi:type when it was needed. I've modified this logic a bit to make it output xsi:type more often in order to preserve round tripping.
Added DB2-specifc support for the OQL LIMIT clause.
In the case a RDBMS does not support the LIMIT/OFFSET clauses, a SyntaxNotSupportedException is thrown.
Added the ability to specify an OFFSET clause with LIMIT clauses. This patch provides support for postgreSQL, mySQL and HSQL only.
Added example to src/examples/MappingTool to demonstrate the use of the MappingTool.
Improved exception handling for the transactionmanager package.
Added XML prefixes to various files in src/examples and src/tests/jdo.
Added code to handle extend relationships where no additional fields are added. For such cases, no STORE SQL statement will be generated (and used).
Upgraded JUnit to version 3.8.1.
Added code to allow users to use their own cache implementation with Castor. In general, available cache implementations are now specified in castor.properties.
Reworked the mailing list guidelines. Added various sections re: cross-posting, etc.
Introduces various checks and additional exception handling wrt to using TimeStampables.
Added separate build folders for src/tests and src/examples to the Eclipse project files.
Updated Eclipse related project files.
Added support for LIMIT/OFFSET clauses for HSQL, and extended HSQL-specific test case.
Added support for registering TxSynchronizable instances via castor.properties.
Added a new converter boolean(true)->numeric(-1) to cover MS Access' way of storing boolean values.
Added Castor JDO test TC20b to mySQL and sapdb categoeries (incl. additions to the SQL DDL).
Added support for RDBMS-specific meta data in general. This is currently used within OracleQueryExpression to support the LIMIT clause implementation for Oracle 8.1.6 and above only.
Added support for LIMIT/OFFSET clauses for Oracle, and fixed problems with mySQL implementation (ordering of parameters).
Added code to support is<FieldName>() methods for boolean properties in addition to standard getter.
Improved debug statements during create operations, showing the actual SQL generated with values bound.
Fixed problem in FieldMolder when dealing with addXXX() methods on fields of type collection.
FieldMolder now looks for is<FieldName>() methods for boolean properties, in addition to standard get<FieldName>() methods.
Fixed problem with loading classes (resulting in IllegalArgumentException) by properly handling ClassNotFoundExceptions.
Added functionality to clear/reset the database configuration. Added functionality to configure Castor JDO via an in-memory JDOConf instance (plus a factory class for creating JdoConf instances).
Fixed problem using the HighLowKeyGenerator with the same-connection attribute set to 'true'.
Provided a patch to initialize array(s) with the correct size, rather than hardcoding the value '10'.
Fixed problem with delayed removal of cache entries when deleting objects.
Added clearCache() method to CastorTestCase, and fixed a problem in test data setup in src/tests/jdo/OqlExtends.java
Added CacheManager (and DatabaseImpl.getCacheManager() method) to allow users to selectively flush the Castor performance cache(s).
Moved CastorException to org.exolab.castore.core.exceptions. In addition, PersistenceException now derives from CastorException.
Fixed NPE in SQL CALL statements with master/detail relation.
Updated list of available mapping types.
Added (general JDO) Utils class.
Fixed various small problems with SQL DDLs in src/tests/jdo.
Refactored code, applying strategy pattern.

Fixes a memory leak with the linked-list implementation by removing LinkedList completely; uses the Hashtable directly, resulting in much better performance. ValuesEnumeration no longer use a Vector, but intercepts the initial enumeration to provide the values.
This improves code quality for the complete jdo package (except conf.*) by removing unused import statements and local variables.
Added log statement to identfy problems with missing collection.
Brought test setup for SAP DB in-line with test requirements.
Brought test config file for SAP DB in-line with XML Schema.
Added test for IdentityKeyGenerator to SAP DB test suite.
Fixed problem with incorrectly quoting non-function names for SAP DB.
Added support for SAB DB to IdentityKeyGenerator.
Fixed various problems related to the setup of JDO test data with SAP DB.
Fixed problem with 'select count(*) ...' statement with HSQL.
Added new TransactionManagerFactory for IBM WebSphere 5.1.
Added code to extend the message generated for ObjectModifiedExceptions.
Fixed a problem with class loading in various places of ParamInfo by passing a ClassLoader instance during instantiation.
Fixed an incorrectly coded equality check related to global transaction demarcation.
Small (mostly syntactical) changes to src/doc/jdo-faq.xml. Added a reference to XPath as well.
Fixed default namespace declaration, changed some small syntax issues.
Fixed a typo in a debug statement (wrong message resource key used).
Added code to support org.exolab.castor.types.Duration as a native type in Castor JDO. Added convertors for type conversion org.exolab.castor.types.Duration <-> java.lang.Long.
Streamlines Eclipse related project files.
Added many enhancements to the tx mgr API including code improvements, jdo-conf.xsd changes, dynamic code generation using Castor XML as well as a refactored Ant build descriptor.
DuplicateIdentityExceptions not reported correctly when using PostgreSQL.

section.p: For all the previous releases, the release notes can be found here.
